data.title: Kyrsten and Reid Deinlein
authors: Submitted to the H-T, The Herald-Times
data.meta_description: Kyrsten Nicole Cramer and Reid Talbot Deinlein, both of Bloomington, were married Sept. 21 at the First Presbyterian Church in Bloomington. The Rev. Andy Kort officiated.
data.text:
Kyrsten Nicole Cramer and Reid Talbot Deinlein, both of Bloomington, were married Sept. 21 at the First Presbyterian Church in Bloomington. The Rev. Andy Kort officiated.

Parents of the bride are Mark Cramer of Bloomington and Kim Shelton of Spartanburg, S.C.

The bridegroom is the son of R. Jack and Lisa Deinlein of Bloomington.

Maid of honor was Maggie Doran of Bloomington.

Bridesmaids were Haley Sinn, Amber Stath and Lyric Brewster, all of Bloomington; Kelly Cramer of New Albany; Audrey Gines of Cannelburg and Caitlyn Williamson of Washington.

Best man was Rett Deinlein of Chicago. Bridegroom’s attendant was Audrey Deinlein of Bloomington.

Groomsmen were Dylan Passwaiter, Jacob Hieftje, and Sean Bailey, all of Bloomington; Theodore Creek of Chicago; and Addison Cramer of New Albany.

Ushers were Matthew Bower of Bloomington; Tim Cramer of Columbus; Caleb Fossee of New Albany; and Dave Krause of Berthoud, Colo.

Flower girls were Annabelle and Lilian Talbot of Louisville, Colo.

Ring bearer was William Meador of Indianapolis.

The reception was held at The Stables in Bloomington.

The couple will spend their honeymoon at St. George Island, Fla., at a later date.

The bride earned a bachelor’s degree in speech and hearing, graduating from Indiana University in 2013. She is a first grade teacher in the Denver Public Schools.

The bridegroom earned a bachelor’s degree in outdoor recreation and human ecology from IU in 2014. He is employed by REI in Denver.

The couple reside in Denver.

How we met

We met in high school.
